required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Treatment Efficacy of a Modified Positive Airway Pressure Device to Treat Obstructive Sleep Apnea

brief_summary.textblock: This study will investigate the efficacy of the FPH modified positive airway pressure (PAP) device with or without SensAwake; and with different pressure support in OSA participants; in both an in-home and in-lab environment. Comfort, compliance and the accuracy of the pressure delivery will also be evaluated. The FPH device will be compared to a market released product.

clinical_study.why_stopped: project progression decision was able to be made with the data already gathered

primary_outcome.description: Through the device and independent flow logger

secondary_outcome.description: Through the device and independent flow logger

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Aged 18 and over
- Diagnosed with OSA by a practicing physician and prescribed Positive Airway Pressure (PAP) - (Continuous Positive Airway Pressure (CPAP) or AutoCPAP). Participants can be na√Øve to CPAP or experienced users of CPAP.
- For experienced users of PAP (CPAP or AutoCPAP): Using the PAP of more than 4 hours/night for 70% during the last 30 days (justification allowed by the investigator)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Contraindicated for PAP (CPAP or AutoCPAP) therapy
- Persons with other significant sleep disorder(s) (e.g periodic leg movements, insomnia, central sleep apnea)
- Persons with obesity hypoventilation syndrome or congestive heart failure.
- Persons that require supplemental oxygen with their PAP (CPAP or AutoCPAP) device
- Persons with implanted electronic medical device (e.g cardiac pacemakers)
- Persons who are pregnant or think they might be pregnant.
